transition.to: textDisplay~Welcome! Usbong is an open-source platform that allows you to create and run, what we call, "Trees."

task-node.name: textDisplay~Welcome! Usbong is an open-source platform that allows you to create and run, what we call, "Trees."

transition.to: textDisplay~"Trees" can be anything from branching storybooks, step-by-step guides, and even clinical pathways.

task-node.name: textDisplay~"Trees" can be anything from branching storybooks, step-by-step guides, and even clinical pathways.

transition.to: textDisplay~The idea is to create trees by putting together components such as checklists, radio buttons, text fields, the camera, the audio recorder, and even a canvas for drawing things. You can also create your own components, say a stopwatch or a mini game, by checking out usbong on {a href="https://code.google.com/p/usbong/"}Google Code{/a}, or sending us a request through "usbong-users@googlegroups.com".

task-node.name: textDisplay~The idea is to create trees by putting together components such as checklists, radio buttons, text fields, the camera, the audio recorder, and even a canvas for drawing things. You can also create your own components, say a stopwatch or a mini game, by checking out usbong on {a href="https://code.google.com/p/usbong/"}Google Code{/a}, or sending us a request through "usbong-users@googlegroups.com".

transition.to: textDisplay~To create your own "Trees", you don't really have to be an experienced programmer or even a technical person for that matter. You can use Google Drive Spreadsheet (or a Graphical User Interface (GUI)) to connect the components together, which are then converted into an XML file that can be played using Usbong.
